Subject: MultiphaseEquil::PrintInfo() does not know about Loglevel
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=279078372; y=9G0usucgWmiIncXw5e9ilkEDULAa88gvigEJxYsCHRjmq54Zsg
X-Yahoo-Profile: mlbeks1975

Dear Prof Goodwin (and others on this list),

Currently I am experimenting =
with Cantera for chemical equilibrium
calculations as part of a model of a =
metal halide lamp. I have
successfully linked Cantera's libraries against m=
y own to provide my
model with local species densities, given the local tem=
perature,
pressure and elemental composition. Unfortunately, only the algor=
ithm
used for the multiphase equilibrium proved stable enough. This
algorit=
hm has the drawback of being far slower than the one used in
the singlephas=
e code. After my collegue did some profiling, however,
we discovered that a=
 lot of time is spent on generating log messages
(in my particular case up =
to 60% of the total time). If the loglevel
is set to -1 this information is=
 discarded. Is there some way to look
at the loglevel before calling Multip=
haseEquil::PrintInfo() ?  Just
commenting out the call to printInfo() alrea=
dy speeds up the
calculation by a factor two.


Regards,

Mark Beks

P.S. o=
n an unrelated issue: is there some way to create dynamic
libraries instead=
 of static libraries?
